section.title: The project/build.xml File
section.p: It is suggested that if you're reading this file that perhaps you should start here at the Jakarta Ant homepage first. The Centipede build.xml file is basically an ant build file with some standard targets in it as well as calls to Cents and your project targets.

section.title: Walkthrough of build.xml
section.p: Build.xml is the main build entry point, and a pure Ant build file. In fact, when you start integrating, it's suggested that you keep your usual build file.
To use the cent, this file contains an inclusion of basic targets, that set up the basic properties from the descriptors and initialize and call the cents.
section.note: The centipede build file puts it at the end, so that line numbers of the build file, when failings occur, remain correct.
section.p: To call a cent you just need to call the call-cent target and specify the cent-name and the cent-target attributes. You can also supply eventual other parameters used by the cent.
That's really all there is to it.
If you want to add your targets, it's better if you do so in another dir (like src/java/targets/[targetname]/xbuild.xml), so that it can later be easily reused in a cent.
